contentrichtext.text: The '''[[Yukon]]''' is a territory in the northwest of Canada. {{TOC right}} '''Yukon''' may also refer to: *[[Yukon (electoral district)]], a federal electoral district of Canada, corresponding to the territory *The [[Yukon River]], a river of Alaska and the Yukon Territory, for which the territory was named ==Other places== *[[Yukon, Missouri]], a town in the United States *[[Yukon, Oklahoma]], a town in the United States *[[Yukon, West Virginia]], a town in the United States *[[Yukon, Florida]], a ghost town in the United States *[[Yukon, Pennsylvania]], a town in the United States ==Agriculture== *The [[Yukon Gold potato]], a common Canadian-grown potato ==Computers and software== * [[Yukon (software)]], a screen capture application for use with OpenGL software * [[AMD mobile platform#Yukon platform (2009)|AMD Yukon]] notebook platform * [[List_of_Marvell_Technology_Group_chipsets#88E80xx .28Yukon.29 Gigabit Ethernet chipsets|Yukon Ethernet Chipset]] manufactured by Marvell * [[Microsoft SQL Server]] 2005 (code name during development) ==Fiction== *Yukon, the name of a fictional confederacy in the novel ''[[Fitzpatrick's War]]'' by Theodore Judson ==Games== * [[Yukon (solitaire)]], a single-player card game similar to standard Klondike solitaire *[[Yukon hold 'em]], similar to other games such as Texas hold 'em and Omaha hold 'em * ''[[The Yukon Trail]]'', a computer game similar to ''The Oregon Trail'' ==Music== *[[Yukon (band)]], a band from Baltimore, Maryland, in the United States ==Transportation== ===Aircraft=== * [[CC-106 Yukon]], a Canadian military turboprop airliner and cargo aircraft used in the 1950s and 1960s ===Ships=== *[[HMCS Yukon|HMCS ''Yukon'']], a Canadian destroyer launched in 1961 that later became an artificial reef off the coast of San Diego, California *[[USC&GS Yukon|USC&GS ''Yukon'']], the name of more than one United States Coast Survey or United States Coast and Geodetic Survey ship *{{USNS|Yukon|T-AO-202}}, a United States Navy fleet replenishment oiler in service with the Military Sealift Command since 1994 *[[USS Yukon]], the name of more than one United States Navy ship ===Vehicles=== *[[GMC Yukon (disambiguation)]], various full-size sport utility vehicles made by General Motors *The Giant Yukon and Giant Yukon DISC, mountain bicycles made by [[Giant Manufacturing]] ==See also== * The [[Klondike Gold Rush]], sometimes referred to as the Yukon Gold Rush * The [[University of Connecticut]], often referred to as UConn, a homophone of "Yukon" * [[Yukon Gold (disambiguation)]] {{disambig}}
